definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)

sentences.english: To show the wangs mobilization, jade was XiaoRong with a slingshot, said he was like a bad guy.
sentences.chinese: 到王家動員秀玉時，卻被曉榮用彈弓打，說他像壞人。

sentences.english: These kinds of jinn can be killed with date or plum stones fired from a sling.
sentences.chinese: 可以用彈弓發射棗核或者李子核射殺這幾種精靈。

sentences.english: The boy discharged a stone from a sling .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩用彈弓射了一粒石子。

sentences.english: David uses his sling and a stone to kill Goliath.
sentences.chinese: 大衛用的的彈弓和石彈殺死巨人歌利亞。

sentences.english: We made our own slingshots and bullets.
sentences.chinese: 我們做出我們自己的彈弓和子彈。

sentences.english: In his right-rear pocket a sling.
sentences.chinese: 右後方口袋裏是一隻彈弓。

sentences.english: She is the creator of "Girls with Slingshots."
sentences.chinese: 她的創造者“女孩用彈弓。”

sentences.english: Throwing off sling, Chuang Tzu had to run out of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 莊子迅速的將彈弓丟在地上，狼狽地跑出慄園。
